result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Mobry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample. Posted bond applied to costs.
Huber granted under jail rules, may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Mobry

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A Mobry

Prior: W1755 Hall Rd, Columbus, WI 53925 United States
filed by Attorney Robert Nagel

Defendant Robert A Mobry in court with attorney Robert Franklin Nagel.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 60 days jail, commence Feb. 15, 2017 at 7 p.m,  may transfer to Dane County Jail. Huber granted under jail rules. $518 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Posted bond applied. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
